definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to be greedy in getting money
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied

sentences.english: Gorged with power, I grew blind to Pokemon being alive.
sentences.chinese: 因貪嗜權力，竟令小生對神奇寶貝之存活盲目不見。

sentences.english: It's a kind of social curiosity, an intellectual voracity.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種對社會的好奇心，一種知識上的貪孌。

sentences.english: A moment on the lips, a lifetime on the hips.
sentences.chinese: 要知道“一時嘴貪，一世肥臀”。

sentences.english: Mr. White have uncontrollable greed for fame and wealth.
sentences.chinese: 懷特先生毫無忌憚地貪求名利。

sentences.english: Even the top gourmand can't eat so much food.
sentences.chinese: 即使最貪喫的人也喫不下這麼多東西啊。

sentences.english: The newts are very gluttonous but rather dovish!
sentences.chinese: 這些蠑螈非常的貪喫但是它們也是相當有節制的。

sentences.english: I've never met a man as gluttonous as him.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒遇到過河他一樣貪喫的人。

sentences.english: It is gluttonous, likes sleeping also likes playing.
sentences.chinese: 它非常貪喫，愛睡覺也愛玩耍。

sentences.english: But if a person is a feaster, scientists believe they produce less of the gut hormone.
sentences.chinese: 但科學家認爲，貪喫型暴食者分泌的這種荷爾蒙更少。

sentences.english: Do not be greedy for windfalls and overdrink yourself either.
sentences.chinese: 勿貪意外之財，勿飲過量之酒。

sentences.english: Don't covet unexpected money, nor drink too much wine.
sentences.chinese: 勿貪意外之財，勿飲過量之酒。

sentences.english: Do Lobha and Dosa bring you happiness?
sentences.chinese: 貪和瞋會帶給你快樂嗎？

sentences.english: These priests are all thus, greedy and avaricious.
sentences.chinese: 所有的神甫全一樣，又貪又吝。

sentences.english: Better a glorious death than a shameful life.
sentences.chinese: 忍辱貪生不如死得光榮。

sentences.english: It is the best weapon for cutting the selfish knot of miserliness .
sentences.chinese: 彼亦爲斷除慳貪執著之最勝武器。

sentences.english: DECAY】Her teeth decayed because she ate too many sweets.
sentences.chinese: 她的牙齒因貪喫甜食而蛀壞。

definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
